map.name: reportname
map.helpText: Name for reference under custom reports

map.name: DateFrom
map.helpText: Indicate the desired starting date for the report

map.name: DateTo
map.helpText: Indicate the desired ending date for the report. Ignored if "Through Today" is checked.

map.name: ThroughToday
map.helpText: Include all records through the current date

map.name: ExcludeWeekends
map.helpText: Exclude weekends in the reports if checked

map.name: IncludeCriteria
map.helpText: Include a column containing report criteria in tabular reports if checked

map.name: ShowGroupCaptions
map.helpText: Show the roll-up/grouping captions (e.g. Cost Code, Department, etc)

map.name: ShowAllGroups
map.helpText: Show all mapped columns from the imported inventory when running tabular reports

map.name: DaysUsedIncludeLocked
map.helpText: Include locked and minimized usage in the calculation for Days Used

map.name: OutputXLS
map.helpText: Select tabular report export format

map.name: GroupColumn4
map.helpText: Inventory columns to display on reports. These values are ignored in tabular reports if Show All Grouping Columns is checked

map.name: UserColumn
map.helpText: Indicates whether data should be per user/terminal (User Level Reporting) or summed together based upon the values in the grouping columns (Roll-Up Reporting)

map.name: Filter1Type
map.helpText: Data classification type

map.name: Filter1Comp
map.helpText: Comparison operator

map.name: Filter1Select
map.helpText: Avaialble selections

map.name: Filter1Val
map.helpText: Selected or entered value

map.name: BulkType
map.helpText: Filter category type

map.name: BulkData
map.helpText: Once the type of data is selected, enter the specific IDs of the individuals to pull data for. Separate entries by a new line. There is a limit of about 400 entries in the Bulk Data field. Note: if the Bulk Data is set to anything other than “None” it will override any active filters.

map.name: screensort
map.helpText: Determines the variable according to which the Top 20 Screens and Launchpad subreports will be sorted—choose between Foreground Minutes, Background Minutes, Total Minutes (Foreground + Background), and Hits

map.name: entitlementsort
map.helpText: Determines the sort order for the Entitlement sub-report graph—choose to sort from high to low or low to high

map.name: exchangesort
map.helpText: Determines the sort order for the Exchange sub-report graph—choose to sort from high to low or low to high

map.name: includeminlock
map.helpText: Determines whether minimized minutes or locked minutes are included in the report (minutes during which the computer is locked or in screen-saver mode)

map.name: italicize
map.helpText: Italicize any screen names that are part of the screen group selected

map.name: exclude
map.helpText: Exclude any screens that are part of the screen group selected

map.name: includeonly
map.helpText: Only include screens that are part of the screen group selected

map.name: alternatelayout
map.helpText: Determines the screen layout of the dashboard (Standard vs Alternate vs Custom)

map.name: screensort
map.helpText: Determines the variable according to which the Top 20 Screens and Launchpad subreports will be sorted—choose between Foreground Minutes, Background Minutes, Total Minutes (Foreground + Background), and Hits

map.name: includeminlock
map.helpText: Determines whether minimized minutes or locked minutes are included in the report (minutes during which the computer is locked or in screen-saver mode)

map.name: alternatelayout
map.helpText: Determines the screen layout of the dashboard (Standard vs Alternate vs Custom)

map.name: applicationname
map.helpText: Selects the market data application for which data will be shown on this report

map.name: screensort
map.helpText: Determines the variable according to which the Top 20 Screens and Launchpad sub-reports will be sorted—choose between Foreground Minutes, Background Minutes, Total Minutes (Foreground + Background), and Hits

map.name: includeminlock
map.helpText: Determines whether minimized minutes or locked minutes are included in the report (minutes during which the computer is locked or in screen-saver mode)

map.name: alternatelayout
map.helpText: Determines the screen layout of the dashboard (Standard vs Alternate vs Custom)

map.name: xaxis
map.helpText: Determines the variable to be displayed on the X-Axis. Choose User Name, Subscription SID, UUID, Access Point ID, Region, Country, Cost Code, Department, or Desk

map.name: xaxistop
map.helpText: Allows X-Axis to be grouped by Region, Country, Cost Code, Department, or Desk, or to have no grouping (None)

map.name: swapxy
map.helpText: Allows axes to be swapped so that dates display along the X-Axis instead of the YAxis

map.name: datasource
map.helpText: Determines the data source used to create the heat map. Choose to use Foreground+Background Minutes, Foreground Minutes, Background Minutes, Total Minutes (includes Locked and Minimized Minutes), or Hits as the data source to create the heat map

map.name: lowval
map.helpText: Set the lower cutoff values for light blue to dark blue fills

map.name: mediumval
map.helpText: Set the lower-middle cutoff values for light blue to dark blue fills

map.name: medium2val
map.helpText: Set the upper-middle cutoff values for light blue to dark blue fills

map.name: highval
map.helpText: Set the upper cutoff values for light blue to dark blue fills

map.name: showfulldaterange
map.helpText: Allows for the option to display the full date range selected (leaving this box unchecked will result in a heat map covering one month of usage)

map.name: sortbygraphdata
map.helpText: Allows for data to be sorted and displayed according to usage

map.name: cutoff
map.helpText: Number of days to include in the report. Days after the cutoff will not be displayed

map.name: highlow
map.helpText: Users with the most total usage over the selected date range are listed first if checked

map.name: applicationname
map.helpText: Name of the market data application for which data will be displayed on this report

map.name: xaxis
map.helpText: Determines the variable to be displayed on the X-Axis. Choose User Name, Inventory ID, Region, Country, Cost Code, Department, or Desk.

map.name: xaxistop
map.helpText: Allows X-Axis to be grouped by Region, Country, Cost Code, Department, or Desk, or to have no grouping (None)

map.name: swapxy
map.helpText: Allows axes to be swapped so that dates display along the X-Axis instead of the Y-Axis

map.name: datasource
map.helpText: Determines the data source used to create the heat map. Choose to use Foreground+Background Minutes, Foreground Minutes, Background Minutes, Total Minutes (includes Locked and Minimized Minutes), or Hits as the data source to create the heat map

map.name: lowval
map.helpText: Set the lower cutoff values for light blue to dark blue fills

map.name: mediumval
map.helpText: Set the lower-middle cutoff values for light blue to dark blue fills

map.name: medium2val
map.helpText: Set the upper-middle cutoff values for light blue to dark blue fills

map.name: highval
map.helpText: Set the upper cutoff values for light blue to dark blue fills

map.name: showfulldaterange
map.helpText: Allows for the option to display the full date range selected (leaving this box unchecked will result in a heat map covering one month of usage)

map.name: sortbygraphdata
map.helpText: Allows for data to be sorted and displayed according to usage

map.name: cutoff
map.helpText: Number of days to include in the report. Days after the cutoff will not be displayed

map.name: highlow
map.helpText: Users with the most total usage over the selected date range are listed first if checked
Lists the screens accessed by each user along with time and hits. This report contains the details that are used to create the Dashboard Top 20 Screens sub-report.
Lists the screens accessed by each user per day along with time and hits.
Lists the Launchpad windows accessed by each user along with time and hits. This report contains the details used to create the Dashboard Launchpad sub-report.
Lists the Launchpad windows accessed by each user per day along with time and hits.
Lists the number and types of incoming and outgoing Bloomberg messages.
Lists the number and types of incoming and outgoing Bloomberg messages per day.
Lists the counts of Instant Bloomberg sessions
Lists the counts of Instant Bloomberg sessions per day
Lists the counts of news services accessed. This provides the details behind the Dashboard News sub-report
Lists the counts of news services accessed per day
Lists the log file collection and usage statistics by terminal. This providesthe details behind the Dashboard Status sub-reports.
Lists the log file collection and usage statistics by terminal per day
Time the user was logged in to Bloomberg
Time the user was logged in to Bloomberg per day
Lists entitlement hits
Lists entitlement hits per day
Lists exchange hits
Lists exchange hits per day
Lists the Access Point SID and SID Inst Numbers for all data collected
Lists terminals not reporting data
Lists the screens accessed by each user along with time and hits. This report contains the details that are used to create the Dashboard Top 20 Screens sub-report.
Lists the screens accessed by each user per day along with time and hits.
Lists the companies searched, and the number of hits on each company. This report contains the details used to create the Dashboard Company sub-report.
Lists the companies searched, and the number of hits on each company per day
Lists the download count. This report provides the details behind the Dashboard Download sub-report.
Lists the download count per day.
Lists the entitlements used. This report contains the details used to create the Dashboard Entitlement sub-report.
Lists the entitlements used per day.
Lists the log file collection and usage statistics by terminal. This provides the details behind the Dashboard Status sub-reports.
Lists the log file collection and usage statistics by terminal per day
Time the user was logged in to Bloomberg
Time the user was logged in to Bloomberg per day
Lists terminals not reporting data
Lists the screens accessed by each user along with time and hits. This report contains the details that are used to create the Dashboard Top 20 Screens sub-report.
Lists the screens accessed by each user along with time and hits per day
Lists exchange hits
Lists exchange hits per day
Lists the log file collection and usage statistics by terminal. This provides the details behind the Dashboard Status sub-reports.
Lists the log file collection and usage statistics by terminal per day.
Lists terminals not reporting data

map.name: reportname
map.helpText: Name for reference under custom reports

map.name: DateFrom
map.helpText: Indicate the desired starting date for the report

map.name: DateTo
map.helpText: Indicate the desired ending date for the report. Ignored if "Through Today" is checked.

map.name: ThroughToday
map.helpText: When checked, the report will cover the past seven weeks

map.name: fromlogs
map.helpText: Days with fewer logs processed than this first value will be marked red, others will be marked yellow or green.

map.name: tologs
map.helpText: Days with more logs processed than this second value will be marked green, others will be marked red or yellow.

map.name: fromsec
map.helpText: Days with processing less than this first value will be marked green, others will be marked yellow or red.

map.name: tosec
map.helpText: Days with processing more than this second value will be marked red, others will be marked yellow or green.

map.name: versions
map.helpText: A comma separated list of allowable MMG Agent versions (without the dots).

map.name: fromver
map.helpText: Days with fewer valid agents than this first value will be marked red, others will be marked yellow or green.

map.name: tover
map.helpText: Days with more valid agents than this second value will be marked green, others will be marked red or yellow.

map.name: reportname
map.helpText: Name for reference under custom reports

map.name: OutputXLS
map.helpText: Select tabular report export format

map.name: sql
map.helpText: Create specialized reports by connecting directly to the database. Please contact MMG Partners for more information about Ad-Hoc reporting.

The Bloomberg Inventory Mismatch Report lists the differences between the monthly SID and Entitlements files from Bloomberg and the Inventory (FITS, MDM) output.
The SID File Usage Report lists all terminals in the Bloomberg SID file and information about recent data capture for each of them.

map.name: MessageCount
map.helpText: Specify the number of messaging addresses to display for each Bloomberg message type. Typing in a value of 0 will select the top 1 message of each message type.
